text: Holyland towers, Ramat Sharett Ramat Sharett () (lit. "Sharett Heights") is a neighbourhood in southwest Jerusalem, located between Ramat Denya and Beit VeGan. The neighborhood was established in 1974 and named for Moshe Sharett, Prime Minister of Israel in 1953-1955. Jerusalem Municipal site Ramat Sharett sits 860 meters above sea level.Jerusalem Municipal site ==Notable residents== *Dalia Itzik *Yigal Yasinov *Ofer Berkovitch ==References== Category:Neighbourhoods of Jerusalem
title: Ramat Sharett
